page.title: 02Sebergham landscape
page.content: The area is dominated by Warnell Fell which is part enclosed and part unfenced rough grazing. The Eastern and Southern slopes of Warnell above the River Caldew are commercial softwood forests. The geological formation is carbon- iferous limestone, millstone grit and the edge of an area of sand on the Eastern bank of the River Caldew. There is a limestone quarry on Warnell Fell and a few old limekilns still existing on the fellside. Stone walls and wire fences are the usual boundaries with some thorn hedges on the lower ground. New farm buildings are mainly steel structures with asbestos or onduline roofs. Older farm buildings are be- coming derelict as they are of little commercial value and not easy to use in conjunction with modern machinery.
